p: Chinotto essential oils were analysed for their capacity to reduce NO production by RAW264,7 macrophages stimulated by 0.5 µg mL −1 lipopolysaccharide (LPS). NO concentrations measured as nitrite were strongly induced after stimulation with LPS for 48 h. Essential oil from half ripe fruits (CEO2) reduced the level of NO in a concentration-dependent way. In particular, CEO2 was found to be already effective at 10 µg mL −1, while an inhibition of >50% was found at 100 µg mL −1. In contrast, CEO1 and CEO3 were ineffective in the concentration range investigated ( Figure 2).
